author: pipermerriam
content:
We talked a bit about data ingress/egress this morning in the state network.  I think we should start investigating what our gossip network might look like because it seems potentially silly to have A) A "gossip" network for new blocks, transactions, and eventually witnesses  B) A state network with it's own gossip and C) A chain history network with it's own gossip.

Combining the state network and chain history network gossip into the single "One gossip network to rule them all" should be investigated.

author: pipermerriam
content: We have no firm architecture requirements but Gossip would likely be either DevP2P or LibP2P based.  We'd want to pay special attention to the network topology to be sure it can work well for both long lives nodes as well as "ephemeral" nodes that may only be part of the network for a few minutes, and everything in-between.

author: pipermerriam
content: And there would likely need to be some sort of "capabilities" that each node publishes since different nodes will probably be interested (and explicitely not interested) in certain types of gossip data.

author: pipermerriam
content: I think this deserves a new channel: `accessible-gossip` or maybe `flexible-gossip`
